result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/Sentencing Hearing 8-15-22 filed by Court Reporter Claire Stein

9:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald L. Jensen in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Ronald L. Jensen. Cases called: 22 CF 258, 20 CF 549, 20 TR 6853 and 20 TR 6800R, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 20 CF 549, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed read in, 22 CF 258 dismissed, read in, 20 TR 6853 and 20 TR 6800R dismissed read in, Court sentences defendant to: 20 CF 549, Ct. 1, 9 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 6 years extended supervision, absolute sobriety,  AODA and comply, defendant to submit DNA Sample, $2,323.00 fine/costs, bond to be applied, 36 months D.L. revocation, 36 months I.I.D., 9 days sentence credit Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program, is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, sentence is forthwith
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton - cover sheet for filing
